content.raw: Does order matter? `g_splashScreen` is created before `g_main_win`, so should it be deleted afterwards? I don't know if it matters
content.html: Does order matter? g_splashScreen is created before g_main_win, so should it be deleted afterwards? I don't know if it matters

content.raw: it's doesn't matter as the splash screen doesn't need to wait for any widgets in the main window to be deleted
content.html: it's doesn't matter as the splash screen doesn't need to wait for any widgets in the main window to be deleted

content.raw:
not sure if it's too late here, is it possible to get an SVG file of this? 

I think it's better to leave out the `Version 4.0`  text in the image otherwise we would need a new image for every version released. It's easy for us to insert a text there via code to show the version number.
content.html:
not sure if it's too late here, is it possible to get an SVG file of this?

I think it's better to leave out the Version 4.0 text in the image otherwise we would need a new image for every version released. It's easy for us to insert a text there via code to show the version number.

content.raw: No problem. I removed the version and made a version with a black border to see what we prefer. Bitbucket won't let me upload the svgs.  Should I email the svgs to the folks on this issue?
content.html: No problem. I removed the version and made a version with a black border to see what we prefer. Bitbucket won't let me upload the svgs. Should I email the svgs to the folks on this issue?

content.raw:
The top corners are showing white to me, is that expected? When I looked at the image at first I thought they would be transparent.

Maybe we can get them to be transparent using masks? [Here](https://wiki.qt.io/Custom_splashscreen_with_text)'s an example, I haven't tried it though, all I did was googling for transparency in `QSplashScreen`s.
content.html:
The top corners are showing white to me, is that expected? When I looked at the image at first I thought they would be transparent.

Maybe we can get them to be transparent using masks? Here's an example, I haven't tried it though, all I did was googling for transparency in QSplashScreens.

content.raw: ya we can do that. We would need to fill everything inside the orange border with white color otherwise the whole thing would be transparent
content.html: ya we can do that. We would need to fill everything inside the orange border with white color otherwise the whole thing would be transparent

content.raw: Yeah that sounds like what I imagined, not sure if that's what @spaepcke had in mind though...
content.html: Yeah that sounds like what I imagined, not sure if that's what @spaepcke had in mind though...

content.raw:
Oh yes, that's how the original image I made was: Filled in white background within the orange border. The top corners should be transparent so there's nothing outside of the orange line.

We need to find a solution to this Inkscape/Illustrator issue...
content.html:
Oh yes, that's how the original image I made was: Filled in white background within the orange border. The top corners should be transparent so there's nothing outside of the orange line.

We need to find a solution to this Inkscape/Illustrator issue...

content.raw:
The splash screen now shows up grey while models are being downloaded. We had a `showMessage` here before to force it to repaint after `show()`.  To fix it the current version we can just add the line:
~~~
  this->dataPtr->splashScreen->repaint();
~~~
content.html:
The splash screen now shows up grey while models are being downloaded. We had a showMessage here before to force it to repaint after show(). To fix it the current version we can just add the line:

  this->dataPtr->splashScreen->repaint();
